args: During their battles in the Askran Kingdom,\nAlfonse and his allies suddenly found themselves\nwhisked away to another world.
After meeting the prince and his friends,\nthey immediately set about searching for\na way home, using the Halidom as a base.
It seems we aren't finding any useful\nleads on the gate today, either.
Indeed—though we did the best we could.
While we tarry here, our homes may be\nin grave danger. We must return as soon\nas we possibly can.
We need a plan, and yet nothing\nwill come to me...
If you guys keep moping around like this,\nsomeone's gonna play a sad trombone\nnoise every time you say something.
I suppose you're right. We just have to\nkeep our chins up and keep searching.
Don't worry—we'll help however we can.
Hey, bubs! We know ya been poundin' the\nstreets all day lookin' for a way home, so\nwe went and made a special dinner for ya.
Consider it yer welcome party, yeah?
It is during truly difficult times when\nfood and fellowship are most important.\nNow please join us in the dining hall.
I had NO idea you were such a big shot,\nMarthy! ...Mind if I call ya Marthy?
Indeed, his exploits are so legendary,\nthey earned him the title of Hero-King.
A moniker I do not deserve; all I have\ndone is fight at the side of my friends.
Aw, stow the modesty! If I'd done half the\nthings you did, I'd walk around with my\nchest puffed out like a balloon!
His modest nature is likely what allowed\nhim to achieve all he did—a lesson you\nwould be wise to heed.
You seem awfully serious tonight, Alfonse.
I was just thinking about how your army\nacts more like a group of friends than a\ntraditional fighting unit.
As far as I'm concerned, we ARE friends—\nand that friendship also extends to you.
Do you not feel the same way about us?
My apologies, but no. The forming of\nfriendships is a thing I don't take lightly.
It's true that I rely on the assistance of\nHeroes summoned from different worlds\nwhen fighting, but that is wholly different.
Marth is one of the Heroes called to your\nworld by your summoner, right?
That's right. He and all the other Heroes\nfight at our side in battle—which is both\nreassuring and greatly appreciated.
And while I trust them implicitly,\nthat isn't the same thing as friendship.
So the Heroes you fight with are allies,\nbut not friends?
Correct. Also, I imagine this is something\nyou will understand as well, but...
The more you care for something,\nthe more painful it is to lose it.
I have a duty, and can't afford such hurt.\nSo if I grow close to someone, I do so\naccepting the potential consequences.
I understand how you feel—and I'm\ncertainly not going to force a friendship\non you if it isn't what you want.
Thank you for understanding.\n...Oh, and for the wonderful food.
Yes. For now, there is something I need to\ninvestigate. If you will excuse me?
He's a very serious and cautious young\nman, isn't he? Even when it comes to\nfriendships.
Yes—although it makes me a bit sad.
I can only imagine it does,\ngiven your own personality.
It's not that I think he's WRONG, per se.\nIt's just that... I mean...
I see no harm in trying to become\nhis friend, if that is what you want.
He may think differently from us, but he\ndoesn't seem opposed to our presence.
I just hope I can convince him\nto become friends eventually...
